meanings.definition: Very small or insignificant in size
meanings.sent1: The tinniest pebble on the beach was easily overlooked.
meanings.sent2: She wore the tinniest ring on her pinky finger.
meanings.sent3: The tinniest ant in the colony was the bravest of them all.
meanings.sent4: His voice was so tinniest that it barely carried across the room.
meanings.sent5: The tinniest star in the sky twinkled faintly.

meanings.sent1: The tinniest cup in the kitchen was actually made of plastic.
meanings.sent2: The tinniest toy soldier had a shiny, tinniest appearance.
meanings.sent3: She baked the tinniest cake in a tinniest tin pan.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as tinniest as the tin foil wrapped around the leftovers.
meanings.sent5: The tinniest robot was painted to look like it was made of tin.

meanings.definition: Having a high-pitched sound like that of metal being struck
meanings.sent1: The tinniest bell in the church tower rang out at noon.
meanings.sent2: The tinniest wind chime sang a sweet, high-pitched melody.
meanings.sent3: The tinniest cricket chirped loudly in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was so tinniest it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The tinniest whistle could be heard from across the field.
